item.title: US Government Shut Down
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:24, topic:533491”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=652284.msg4371902#msg4371902 date=1380907111]

[quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=652284.msg4371901#msg4371901 date=1380906944]

because they don’t want to be voted out their next term.

Don’t you still have death penalty for treason? They’re hurting the American public for their own gain, that is no defence for acting like idiots.
[/quote]I know they’re hurting Americans for their own gain. Tea baggers are a more severe version of that though. A lot of the republicans aren’t even for this.

If Boehner would let the House vote for the clean act on the floor, it would pass right now. Thats why I am saying its controlled by a Republican MINORITY.

Then they need to kick Boehner out. They are themselves at fault for letting a lunatic take control of the house.
[/quote]Naw shit.

If that happened, it’d be a democraticly controlled government and god forbid that be the end of the world for all the republicans out there.

What do you mean? I know of several instances here in Norway were people have been kicked out of political parties for being too extreme, and/or for working against their political goals. Those excluded have started their own parties that nobody cares about, and the problem is gone.[/quote]What I meant is if Boehner was kicked out, which probably won’t happen, a democratic Speaker of the House would most likely be voted in. This whole government shutdown is ruining the republicans’ reputation and they’re losing party members as we speak.

Read full topic

Then they need to kick Boehner out. They are themselves at fault for letting a lunatic take control of the house.

If that happened, it’d be a democraticly controlled government and god forbid that be the end of the world for all the republicans out there.[/quote]
What do you mean? I know of several instances here in Norway were people have been kicked out of political parties for being too extreme, and/or for working against their political goals. Those excluded have started their own parties that nobody cares about, and the problem is gone.

item.title: US Government Shut Down
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:17, topic:533491”][quote author=Frell link=topic=652284.msg4371882#msg4371882 date=1380904210]

Wait too long and GOP can block it.

Democrats in the US are known for aiming for short-term goals, where Republicans tend to look at the long term risks.
[/quote]
Yes, just live in your republican bubble.[/quote]

Frell:

even though both parties are aiming for the same thing in the end.

Short term doesn’t mean bad, it has a good effect for the first decade or so and then issues start to rise (example: carters housing shit)

Read full topic

item.title: US Government Shut Down
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:15, topic:533491”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=652284.msg4371854#msg4371854 date=1380898416]

[quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=652284.msg4371740#msg4371740 date=1380846228]

They have grown some balls.

False, the Democrats just won’t kill Obama’s greatest/only achievement in office. That is Obama’s red line. They are usually happy to give GOP what they want.
[/quote]They do, but they have grown some balls. The gpo will give in sooner or later.

They have not grown balls when they surrender in every other issue.
[/quote]Democrats won’t negoatiate.

If you have noticed, its a Republican minority. Its the damn teabaggers. The majority of the republicans who aren’t tea baggers don’t agree with this strategy. They may not agree with Obamacare, but they don’t agree with the government shut down either.

This shut down puts my dad and I jobless as we both work for the National Park Service.

That is not true, the majority of the party agrees with them, or else this issue wouldn’t be an issue.

Frell: Obama is right in pushing this forward. Wait too long and GOP can block it. It is much easier to prevent it from happening, than reverse it when it is already in effect.

But yes, Obamacare is a terrible law, that no sane European party would copy.[/quote]That majority of the Republicans “agree” and I quote that because its a shifty word, because they don’t want to be voted out their next term.

I never said Obamacare was flawless as I agree there are a few kinks to work out, but this isn’t the way to go about it.

Read full topic

item.title: US Government Shut Down
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Bowser jr:

Wait too long and GOP can block it.

They’re not against the idea of NHS, they’re against Obamacare specifically because of how it works. If we’re going to have NHS then they want it done properly. Democrats in the US are known for aiming for short-term goals, where Republicans tend to look at the long term risks. This makes Democrats seem more progressive even though both parties are aiming for the same thing in the end.

Read full topic

They have not grown balls when they surrender in every other issue.

If you have noticed, its a Republican minority. Its the damn teabaggers. The majority of the republicans who aren’t tea baggers don’t agree with this strategy. They may not agree with Obamacare, but they don’t agree with the government shut down either.

This shut down puts my dad and I jobless as we both work for the National Park Service.[/quote]
That is not true, the majority of the party agrees with them, or else this issue wouldn’t be an issue.

Frell: Obama is right in pushing this forward. Wait too long and GOP can block it. It is much easier to prevent it from happening, than reverse it when it is already in effect.

But yes, Obamacare is a terrible law, that no sane European party would copy.

item.title: US Government Shut Down
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Saw this comment:

“The Republicans only want (latest compromise offer)for the Obamacare to be equal for all and be NO exemptions for Obama and his family, or Congress and their family, Federal judges or big businesses. But no, they want to be exempt because who in the hell can afford 9.5% of their income to pay for it. If the President makes $450,000 a year his health care would be $42,750 a year under his own stupid plan. He should have to pay it if we have to pay it. Fair is fair!!! Thank a Republican for fighting for equality!”

I haven’t really been following this whole deal but if the above is true then it makes sense that Obama would put the majority of the stress on the middle class

Even though RiiPiinFtW sees this as the republicans just hating it for no reason, there are alot of hidden clauses in the bill. They’ve been on the headlines a few times over the past few years. The general right-wing consensus is NHS is good but Obama is trying to push it through too fast because this is the only thing he’ll be known for. Republicans are mad because Obama hasn’t considered the risks his brute-force approach to switching to the new system may cause.

with that said holding it hostage to a shut down is stupid

Read full topic
